newsitem.title: CANADA: Toronto stocks seen trending higher at open.
newsitem.headline: Toronto stocks seen trending higher at open.

text.p: CHANGE CHANGE

CANDLR 1.3850 LME CASH ALUM US$1689.5 +71.5
CAN 30-YR 120.04 -0.05 BRENT CRUDE US$18.63 +0.10
Toronto stocks were seen headed higher at Monday's open after closing mixed on Friday as investors eye a big week for economic news. * Second quarter earnings seen wrapping up.
Toronto's key stock index was seen firming at Monday's open, with investors expected to forsake the formerly high-flying interest-sensitive equities in favor of resource-based issues, traders said.
"I think the overall market in Toronto will still do a little better," one trader said. "There's going to be value-pickers out there and it'll lean into resource-based stocks."
As second quarter earnings wind down this week, market players will focus on a slew of U.S. and Canadian economic earnings, staring on Tuesday, traders said.

"I think we'll start to focus again on economics and this week will be a good week," another trader said. Tuesday's statistics include the U.S. second quarter employment cost index and Canada's Industrial Product Price Index for June.

The Toronto Stock Exchange's 300 Composite Index slipped 4.88 points to 6780.27 by Friday's close, snapping a three-day winning streak based on rallying bank issues. But it still managed to set an intraday and life-time high of 6803.71 points.
Golds and forestry issues are expected to pick up where banks left off, the first trader said.
--- STOCKS TO WATCH ---

* Despite a slackening in the pace of quarterly earnings, the Western world's largest nickel miner Inco Ltd is expected to report second quarter earnings today. Analysts forecast a profit of US$0.16 a share versus year-earlier US$0.47

* Financially troubled Repap Enterprises Inc said early on Monday that its second quarter loss widened to C$0.39 a share, including a C$30.3 million charge for discontinued operations, from C$0.35 a year ago.

The paper maker also said it would issue 625 million common shares to repay its US$130 million 8.5 percent convertible debentures due August 1. Repap currently has about 123 million common shares outstanding.
* Gulf Canada Resources Ltd on Monday announced it would acquire Stampeder Exploration Ltd in a friendly stock-swap worth about C$1.0 billion.
Also, analysts said interest would shift to natural resource sectors after last week's rally on the back of interest-sensitive issues including banks.
Ten of Toronto's 14 sub-sectors took the higher road, led by golds, base metals, media and pipelines.
The weaker groups included conglomerates and oils.
At the open winning issues outpaced decliners 208 to 197 while 199 traded flat.
--- HOT STOCKS ---

* Energy firm Stampeder Exploration Ltd jumped 1 to 6.70 on 2.5 million shares after it said on Monday that it would be acquired by Gulf Canada Resources Ltd in a friendly stock-swap worth about C$1 billion.
Gulf said it would offer 0.69124 of a share for each Stampeder share for a value of C$7.50 a share. Gulf slipped 0.80 to 10 in heavy trading.

* Money-losing Repap Enterprises Inc fell 0.075 to 0.195 after reporting its second quarter loss widened to C$0.39 a share, including a C$30.3 million charge for discontinued operations, from C$0.35 a year ago.
* Gandalf, which was re-opened for trading after Friday's halt, dropped 0.51 to 0.47 following last week's news that it filed for creditor protection and would reorganize.
((Lydia Zajc, Reuters Toronto Bureau (416) 941-8109))
